title: BBC Local Live: Devon and Cornwall Monday 14 March - BBC News
summary: a 300ft deep mine shaft opens up under the patio of a house in cornwall .
exeter football boss slams 'stupid ' smoke grenade stunt .
police are trying to reduce `` unacceptable '' levels of homelessness in devon and cornwall .
there are calls for more action to tackle the spread of pacific oysters in the helford estuary .
a man appears in court in connection with the death of a cyclist who was returning from a shout as a lifeboat volunteer .
derriford hospital 's cardiothoracic centre has carried out 20,000 heart operations since opening in 1997 .

documents.title: our live coverage
text: that 's all from bbc local live in devon and cornwall today .
we 'll be back at 08:00 to bring you all tuesday 's news , sport , travel and weather updates .
do n't miss bbc spotlight at 18:30 tonight and the late bulletin at 22:30 .

documents.title: weather for devon and cornwall : a clear , cool night followed by a fine and sunny day
text: it will be a dry night across the region with largely clear skies allowing temperatures to drop and perhaps a patchy frost to form across sheltered inland locations .
minimum temperature : 1 deg c ( 34 deg f ) .
tomorrow will be a largely fine day with good spells of sunshine , although it will feel chilly in the brisk easterly wind with a maximum temperature of 11 deg c ( 52 deg f ) .
author: David Braine, Weather Forecaster

documents.title: news headlines for devon and cornwall
text: - a 300ft former mine shaft opens up under the patio of a cornish house
- there 's been a rise in the number of rough sleepers in the region
- a cyclist killed in the early hours of saturday was a lifeboat volunteer returning from a shout
- a kingsbridge driver 's car is superglued in a `` pointless '' attack
- smoke grenade stunt is branded `` extremely stupid '' by exeter fc boss
- concerns are raised that farmed pacific oysters could harm the helford estuary 's ecology
author: Lynne French, BBC News Online

documents.title: specialists clear asbestos from plymouth 'eyesore ' ahead of demolition
text: specialists in asbestos removal are decontaminating the stairwells of a 10-storey building on plymouth hoe before it 's razed to the ground .

the quality hotel , which has been targeted by arsonists and vandals and described by the city council as an `` eyesore '' will be demolished in two or three months , once all the asbestos has been safely removed .
plymouth city council , which bought the building earlier this year , hopes it will be replaced with a four or five-star hotel that will attract tourists and businesses to the city .
author: Carys Edwards, Business & Industry Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: travel updates for devon and cornwall
text: - in cornwall , there 's slow traffic on the a30 at temple eastbound between blacktor downs road and jamaica inn road due to an earlier vehicle fire .
- reports of an accident in probus on the a390 near the trewithen roundabout and the garden centre .
- in plymouth , cobourg street is closed one way for roadworks at mayflower street , resulting in traffic congestion .
- tamar crossings say the service is `` slightly off scheduled times '' due to shipping movement .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: world 's tallest tree species planted at eden project
text: a forest of redwood trees - the tallest species in the world - has been planted at the eden project in cornwall .
the species can grow to be more than 300ft tall - about the size of big ben - and live for more than 4,000 years .
children from lanlivery school helped eden 's gardeners and apprentices to plant 40 redwood seedlings among the daffodils at the venue 's entrance .
author: David George
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: on the first day of sailing rowing gigs and chickens for scilly
text: today 's freight for scillonian iii : two gigs , four containers and a couple of pallets of live chickens @ twitterid

documents.title: cyclist will be 'fondly remembered '
text: a cyclist who died in a crash in plymouth early on saturday morning was a `` valued '' volunteer with the rnli .

nathan dale , 34 , was cycling home after attending a shout at plymouth lifeboat station early on saturday morning when the crash happened , and he died at derriford hospital as a result of his injuries .

david lister , plymouth rnli volunteer lifeboat operations manager , said : `` not only did nathan dedicate his time to the operation of the lifeboat , he was also involved with many fundraising events at the station , as well as volunteering with other charities . ''
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: mine shaft area likened to 'swiss cheese '
text: a 300ft mine shaft has opened up under the patio of a house at scorrier in cornwall .
the gaping hole was discovered when surveyors checked the site after the empty house was put up for sale .
several old mines have opened up in the county recently - including one at telegraph hill in st day - with a local surveyor likening the area to a `` massive bit of swiss cheese '' .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: hms bulwark in cornish waters preparing for major exercise
text: # hmsbulwark are warming up for a major anglo-french exercise at # pentewan beach

documents.title: councillors vote in favour of new mawnan homes , despite local ire
text: a 46-home development in mawnan smith in cornwall will get the go ahead despite the protestations of residents and the parish council , as long as an affordable housing agreement is reached .
author: Falmouth Packet

documents.title: increase in number of rough sleepers
text: the number of homeless people sleeping on the streets in cornwall has increased from 40 to 65 over the past 12 months , according to figures from the ymca .
the figures have also risen in devon , with 45 rough sleepers in exeter compared with just five , six years ago .
devon and cornwall police have called the level of homelessness `` unacceptable '' .
and say officers are working with aid agencies to encourage people to use overnight shelters .
author: Simon Hall, Home Affairs Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: oops ! who 's a mucky pup then ?
text: mud-loving retriever harlem is plucked to safety by @ twitterid after he became stuck
@ twitterid @ twitterid meanwhile harlems ' sibling is like 'look how good i am ' well done , good outcome by the sar teams .
beautiful dogs as well

documents.title: pants on fire ! man sets fire to love rival 's boxers
text: a jealous man stuffed the pants of a suspected love rival in the toaster after he found them at his ex-partner 's flat , a court heard .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: asbestos cleared ahead of hotel demolition
text: asbestos is being removed from a plymouth `` eyesore '' ahead of its demolition .

the 10-storey former quality hotel , which has been the target of several arson attacks , is expected to be replaced with a four or five-star hotel that the city council hopes will attract tourists and businesses to the city from around the world .
the asbestos removal is being carried out by teams of specialists under strictly controlled conditions , with the building being razed to the ground by gilpin demotion in about two months .
author: Carys Edwards, Business & Industry Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: plymouth sanctuary for 25 syrian families
text: plymouth has agreed to provide sanctuary to another 25 syrian refugee families fleeing the conflict .
plymouth city council has agreed to provide homes for the families over the next three years .
in december 2015 the council agreed to accept three families of syrian refugees , who are now settling into the city .
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel updates for devon and cornwall
text: - long delays on the a30 in cornwall due to a vehicle fire at temple , with one lane eastbound closed between blacktor downs road and jamaica inn road .
- on the a38 in devon , haldon hill exeter-bound between racecourse junction and splatford split one lane is blocked due to broken down vehicle .
- in penzance the a30 eastern green is partially blocked near the chy-an-mor roundabout due to an accident , with delays in both directions .
- very heavy traffic in plymouth at marsh mills , with the slip road onto the .
a38 exeter-bound partially blocked by a broken down lorry .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: gerald pitts is new boss of falmouth docks
text: falmouth docks has a new man in charge after a & p group appoint former apprentice gerald pitts as the company 's managing director .
author: Falmouth Packet

documents.title: witnesses sought for newquay hit-and-run
text: police are appealing for witnesses after a man was left injured and `` dazed in the middle of the road '' in a hit-and-run incident in newquay .
author: Cornish Guardian

documents.title: kingsbridge glue attacker seals car from owner
text: a woman has been locked out of her car after it was sealed with a super-strong glue .
the attacker sealed the locks , door , petrol cap and even the wipers on the citroen in kingsbridge , devon .
police said such attacks were often retaliation , but said the citroen 's owner was a `` lovely person and we do not know the motive behind it '' .
the attack was `` pointless '' and caused `` great upset , distress and inconvenience '' , said pc rich loxton .
author: Jonathan Morris, BBC News Online

documents.title: weather for devon and cornwall : mostly dry with patchy cloud and sunny spells
text: a fine and largely sunny afternoon across the region , although the easterly breeze will persist making it feel quite cool , especially across southern coastal locations such as torbay where there may be some patchy cloud at times .
maximum temperature : 8c ( 46f ) .
it will be a dry night with largely clear skies allowing temperatures to drop and perhaps a patchy frost to form across sheltered inland locations .
minimum temperature : 1c ( 34f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: oyster company unaware of adverse effect of farmed species
text: the company that farms pacific oysters in the helford estuary in cornwall says it 's not aware of any adverse impact the shellfish are having on the ecology of the area .
the duchy oyster farm has been responding to concerns that the non-native species could take over in the special area of conservation .
the wright brothers ' oyster farm , leased from the duke of cornwall , cultivates and harvests more than 10 million native and pacific oysters a year .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: driver in 'critical ' condition after devon crash
text: a man is critically ill following a crash at totnes at around 6.10am on saturday morning when a ford fusion left the a385 near to longcombe cross and collided with a tree .
the driver , a 66-year-old man from brixham , sustained serious chest injuries and was taken to derriford hospital where he remains in a critical but stable condition , according to police .
the road was closed for eight hours while the scene was examined and officers are appealing for witnesses .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: council gets knickers in a twist over east devon nudists
text: town councillors in budleigh have rejected nudists ' calls to lengthen the town 's `` clothes optional '' beach by 200 yards because pebbles west of steamer steps are being washed away - leaving hard , flat clay behind for them to sit on .
author: Exeter Express & Echo

documents.title: ship brings 'bounty ' from the mainland !
text: hurrah !
the scillonian iii has arrived back on scilly for first time since autumn bringing bounty from t'mainland

enjoyed it shame no ashore .

@ twitterid mind the paint

documents.title: cyclist killed in crash was lifeboat volunteer
text: a cyclist who died following a collision in the early hours of saturday morning has been named as 34-year-old nathan dale from plymouth .
he was cycling home after attending the plymouth lifeboat station where he was a volunteer , devon and cornwall police say .

at about 03:10 , emergency services responded to reports of a collision between a cyclist and a car in the vicinity of the footbridge over outland road , plymouth , near devonport high school for girls .
sonny richards , 24 , also from plymouth , has been charged with causing death by dangerous driving and is due to appear in magistrates court today .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: a 100m-deep mine shaft has opened up under the patio of a cornwall house
text: a 100m-deep mine shaft has opened up under the patio of a house at scorrier in cornwall .
@ twitterid @ twitterid gold !
@ twitterid @ twitterid it 's all mine !
@ twitterid was that drone footage of the mineshaft ?
author: Jonathan Morris, BBC News Online

documents.title: news headlines for devon and cornwall
text: - a 300ft mine shaft opens up under the patio of a house in cornwall
- exeter city boss slams an `` extremely stupid '' smoke grenade stunt at saturday 's match
- a cyclist killed in a crash in the early hours of sunday was a lifeboat volunteer
- farmed pacific oysters on the helford estuary are causing concerns for the area 's ecology
- about 20,000 heart operations have been performed at derriford hospital cardiothoracic centre
author: Lynne French, BBC News Online

documents.title: cornish pirates boss ian davies to leave due to 'budget limitations '
text: cornish pirates director of rugby ian davies will leave the club at the end of the season because of `` budget limitations '' .
coaches gavin cattle and alan paver , who have both played for the side under davies , will take charge next season .

`` delays to the 'stadium 4 cornwall ' project have created budget pressures for the cornish pirates and as a consequence , playing budgets have had to be reduced for next season , '' said a statement on the club 's website .
author: James Law
BBC Sport Online

documents.title: hospital waiting times are in the headlines again - how long have you had to to wait ?
text: hospital waiting times are making the headlines again today , so how long have you had to wait at a & e or minor injuries ?
join the debate by giving the phone-in a call on 0345 301 1034 .
that 's today with me , bill buckley , from 13:00 .
author: Bill Buckley
BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: search for penzance jewellery thieves
text: jewellery worth thousands of pounds has been stolen from a shop in penzance , cornwall .
the thieves , who got inside tony walton 's town centre jewellers through a first floor window by using a ladder , took various items of high-value jewellery , including rings and bracelets ,
anyone who saw a ladder being used near the building in chapel street in the early hours of thursday is asked to contact devon and cornwall police .
author: Lynne French, BBC News Online

documents.title: travel updates for devon and cornwall
text: - in devon , the teignmouth to shaldon ferry which was suspended due to the big swell is expected to resume service at 13:00 .
- advance warning of an overnight cornwall-bound closure on the a38 in plymouth at st budeaux .
the entry slip will be closed between 20:00 and 06:00 with diversions via weston mill .
- congestion remaining in exeter around countess wear on topsham road and rydon lane .
- there are reports of an accident in ottery st. mary on the b3174 exeter road around cadhay lane .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: joint approach to cutting road deaths
text: our very own sgt olly will be chatting to fitz at midday about tht .
radio devon - david fitzgerald , 14/03/2016

documents.title: firefighters tackle launceston gorse fire
text: twelve firefighters were called to tackle a gorse fire near pipers pool , launceston , on sunday evening after the alarm was raised by members of the public .
author: Cornish Guardian

documents.title: twenty thousand heart ops for cardiac centre
text: the specialist cardiothoracic centre at derriford hospital has carried out 20,000 heart operations in the past twenty years .
before professor terence lewis established the centre in 1997 , patients needing heart surgery in devon and cornwall had to travel to london .

documents.title: let 's talk about home alone kids , top gear and public loos
text: on the show today home alone children , top gear and the cenotaph and the question of whether businesses should pay for public toilets to stay open .
laurence may be away this week , but you can still join the debate by calling the phone-in on 01872 22 22 22 from midday .
author: Julie Skentelbery
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: tide times for devon and cornwall
text: if you 're planning to take a trip to the coast today , here are the times of high water around the region .
i 'll have a full round-up of the weather in the lunchtime news at 13:30
author: Emily Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: jungle training for plymouth marines
text: royal marines have also been honing their jungle fighting skills in slightly warmer climes

documents.title: use of smoke grenade at exeter city 'extremely stupid ' , says club chairman
text: exeter city chairman julian tagg says the use of a smoke grenade which caused saturday 's league two game with carlisle to be halted for more than an hour was `` extremely stupid '' .
the stagecoach stand at st james park had to be evacuated 10 minutes into the match , which went on to finish 2-2 , and an arrest was made .
`` it 's a wooden grandstand , and everyone remembers the tragic time in bradford , '' tagg told bbc radio devon .
`` sometimes , in an innocent way , they think they 're creating some atmosphere , but actually they 're being extremely stupid . ''
author: James Law
BBC Sport Online

documents.title: single mum 's horror at the hands of a serial love-rat conman
text: a plymouth mum has spoken for the first time about how she was conned by a serial loverat who was jailed after telling a string of lies to get cash - including telling friends and neighbours she had cancer .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: scorrier mine shaft found under patio
text: a mine shaft has opened up under the patio of a cornwall house .
the 100m ( 300ft ) deep shaft at scorrier was discovered when surveyors were checking the site for the sale of the house .
drone footage shows the depth of the shaft , which is among a number found recently in the area .
the shaft is thought to be a remnant of the cornwall 's tin mining industry in the 18th century and will be recapped with concrete .
author: Jonathan Morris, BBC News Online

documents.title: torbay hospital publishes live accident and emergency wait times
text: torbay hospital is starting to publish live waiting times on its website for accident , emergency and minor injuries .

it 's believed to be the first hospital in the south west to let patients see how long a wait they 'll have , with the aim of encouraging them to choose the `` right place and time '' to visit the hospital .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: news headlines for devon and cornwall
text: - a 300ft mine shaft has opened up under the patio of a house in cornwall
- police are to tackle `` unacceptable '' levels of homelessness and begging in the region
- a man is due to appear in court in connection with the death of a cyclist in plymouth
- conservationists are calling for action to tackle invasive pacific oysters in the helford estuary
- torbay hospital is publishing live waiting times for accident and emergency patients on its website
author: Lynne French, BBC News Online

documents.title: royal cornwall hospital 's 'worst winter pressures '
text: the man in charge of the emergency department at cornwall 's main hospital says a `` perfect storm '' of huge numbers of people getting stuck in its beds and a dramatic rise in the numbers of patients through its doors has led to the worst pressures it has faced in a decade .
author: West Briton

documents.title: travel updates for devon and cornwall
text: - slow traffic in exeter on magdalen road around college road due to traffic light failure .
- also in exeter , traffic is at a standstill on topsham road , all the way back past countess wear to sannervile way at bridge road .
- in chudleigh , on the a38 at haldon hill exeter-bound one lane is blocked due to an accident .
- some torpoint ferry delays after services were temporarily stopped for a shipping movement , involving hms ocean .
- in cornwall on the a390 there 's congestion in truro at arch hill roundabout with the sheer volume of traffic .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: superglue attack on kingsbridge car
text: a car 's doors , wiper blades , petrol cap and locks have been superglued in kingsbridge .
devon and cornwall police said the `` pointless '' crime has caused great distress to the vehicle 's `` lovely '' owner .

the kingsbridge police 's facebook page said : `` if you are the person who did this then maybe get in touch so we can discuss your reasons behind it and save us the financial costs of a forensic investigation . ''
author: Lynne French, BBC News Online

documents.title: tumble dryers - new warning from fire chiefs
text: fire chiefs are warning of a `` white goods time bomb '' and say that the current system of recalling faulty tumble dryers is ineffective - and could cost lives .
author: Torquay Herald Express

documents.title: plymouth cyclist death accused in court
text: a man will appear in court later charged in connection with the death of a cyclist in plymouth 's outland road in the early hours of saturday .
the 34-year-old male cyclist was taken to derriford hospital where he died from his injuries .
devon and cornwall police said a 24-year-old man has been charged with causing death by careless driving while under the influence of alcohol .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: spring 's here and the scillonian sets sail !
text: # scillonian iii comes alongside lighthouse pier # penzance .
we 'd love to hear your # scilly crossing stories
@ twitterid @ twitterid we went on the scillonian on our honeymoon in 2003 .
it was our 1st trip to scilly & we fell in love with it .

documents.title: devon and cornwall 's weather : mostly dry and settled with patchy cloud and sunny spells
text: a cloudy start this morning with haze or mist in places , but through the day , the cloud will tend to thin and break , with the best of the sunshine across western parts by midday .
a chilly breeze will persist across the county , however , making it feel quite cool with a maximum temperature of 8c ( 46f ) .
patchy cloud will move in from the west this evening , and will stay around for much of the night .
it will also feel cold , with perhaps some mist and a patchy frost developing in rural areas and a minimum temperature of 1c ( 34f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: calls for action against 'invasive ' pacific oysters
text: conservationists say more action is needed to tackle the spread of an invasive species of farmed oysters in cornwall .
they fear if nothing is done , pacific oysters could take over in the special area of conservation of the helford estuary .
the cornwall wildlife trust says it is worried about the impact the pacific oysters will have on the area 's biodiversity .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: police tackle 'unacceptable ' homeless levels
text: devon and cornwall police are beginning an operation to reduce homelessness and begging on the region 's streets , claiming the level of rough sleepers in exeter is becoming `` unacceptable '' .
the force says officers will now direct them to shelters and support , but the can also move them on if they refuse help .
author: Simon Hall, Home Affairs Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: travel updates for devon and cornwall
text: - trains between newton abbot and exeter st davids are running about 25 minutes late due to earlier engineering works .
- in cornwall the king harry ferry at trelissick is out of service today for annual maintenance .
- there are reports on an accident in cornwall on the a30 carland cross eastbound just before the a39 .
- some delays are expected this morning because of two large loads being moved separately from the a30 to holsworthy .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for monday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Lynne French, BBC News Online
